Iasmin Goes and [Stephen B. Kaplan](http://stephenbkaplan.com/) (2024). "Crude Credit: The Political Economy of Natural Resource Booms and Sovereign Debt Management." *World Development* 180:106645. [PDF (Gated)](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.worlddev.2024.106645) \| [PDF (Ungated, Pre-Print)](papers/Goes-Kaplan.pdf) \| [Replication Materials](https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/NWWX4E)

Iasmin Goes and [Terrence L. Chapman](https://terrencechapman.weebly.com/) (2024). "Can 'Soft' Advice From International Organizations Catalyze Natural Resource Sector Reform?" *International Studies Quarterly* 68(2):sqae048. [PDF (Gated)](https://doi.org/10.1093/isq/sqae048) \| [PDF (Ungated, Pre-Print)](papers/Goes-Chapman.pdf) \| [Replication Materials](https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/V5MWRF)

Iasmin Goes (2023). "New Data, New Results? How Data Sources and Vintages Affect the Replicability of Research." *Research & Politics* 10(2):1--13. [PDF (Open Access)](https://doi.org/10.1177/20531680231170502) \| [Replication Materials](https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/G9QZOU)

Iasmin Goes (2023). "Examining the Effect of IMF Conditionality on Natural Resource Policy." *Economics & Politics* 35(1):227--285. [PDF (Open Access)](https://doi.org/10.1111/ecpo.12214) \| [Replication Materials](https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/9RURWP)

Iasmin Goes (2022). "Electoral Politics, Fiscal Policy, and the Resource Curse." *Studies in Comparative International Development* 57:525--576. [PDF (Gated)](https://doi.org/10.1007/s12116-022-09367-8) \| [PDF (Ungated, View Only)](https://rdcu.be/cU1nr) \| [Replication Materials](https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/8HUQIF)

Iasmin Goes (2013). "Between Truth and Amnesia: State Terrorism, Human Rights Violations and Transitional Justice in Brazil." *European Review of Latin America and the Caribbean* 94:83--96. [PDF (Open Access)](http://doi.org/10.18352/erlacs.8395)

### Work in Progress

[Carolina Moehlecke](https://www.carolinamoehlecke.com/), Iasmin Goes, and [Ariana Ribeiro Costa](https://ri.fgv.br/en/pessoas/ariana-ribeiro-costa). "Local Politics, Global Capital: The Effects of Domestic Political Ties on Foreign Direct Investment Attraction." *Under Review.* [PDF](papers/Moehlecke-Goes-Costa.pdf)

Iasmin Goes. "When Countries Revise Their Data." *Under Review.* [PDF](papers/Goes-WDI.pdf)

Iasmin Goes and [Terrence L. Chapman](https://terrencechapman.weebly.com/). "Climate Commitments and Creative Accounting: How International Organizations Navigate Conflicting Demands." [PDF](papers/Goes-Chapman-WB.pdf)

[Vinicius Curti Cícero](https://vcicero.github.io/) and Iasmin Goes. "Electoral Accountability After Economic Shocks: Evidence from Mayoral Elections in Brazil."

[Daniel Weitzel](https://www.danweitzel.net/), [Zeynep Somer-Topcu](https://zeynepsomer.com/), Iasmin Goes, and [Elise Frelin](https://pureportal.strath.ac.uk/en/persons/elise-frelin). "Political Candidates on Twitter: How do Social Media Campaigns of Candidates Respond to the Public's Issue Priorities?"

Iasmin Goes and [Daniel Weitzel](https://www.danweitzel.net/). "You Should (Probably) Not Split Your Sample."

Iasmin Goes, [Carolina Moehlecke](https://www.carolinamoehlecke.com/), and [Erica Owen](https://sites.google.com/view/erica-owen). "A Comparative Analysis of Firm-Level Foreign Investment Data."
